SEARCH
Package gw.api.rest.framework.v1

Class QueryUtil

java.lang.Object
gw.api.rest.framework.v1.QueryUtil
public class QueryUtil extends Object
This will produce a standard set of processing which is typically described in yaml as: * Supported named filters add any named filters * Common actions * Sortable property names

* Supported filter properties are:

* date parsing: - 'now' is recognized as the current date - P or -P and duration act as offset https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601 * Supported operations for all property are (case insensitive): - 'eq' is equal, 'ne' is not equal, if value omitted or 'null', will test against null - 'in' (or 'ni') this is (or is not) an element of a set of values, - 'lt' less than, 'gt' greater than, 'le' less than or equal, 'ge' greater than or equal. * Additional supported operations for string property are (all string values are compared case insensitive): - 'sw' starts with - 'cn' string contains value * Filtering on child property accepts root if any child matches. The simplest calling pattern (where there is no named filters, and all the properties for the filter/sort are on the query table) var query = Queries.createQuery(entityType.TYPE.get()) var pageInfo = new PageInfo(requestContext, page) var items = QueryUtil.performQuery(pageInfo, query, filters, sorts, config) return XyzPage.wrap(pageInfo.createPage(items.map(convert))) If there are named filters you will have to something like: var query = Queries.createQuery(entityType.TYPE.get()) var pageInfo = new PageInfo(requestContext) Mapinvalid input: '<'String, List> filterActions = parseFilters(filters, config.propParse); List sortActions = parseSortActions(sorts, config.sortPropNames); if (filterActions.contains("xyzFilter")) { ... implement xyz filter } var items = QueryUtil.performQuery(pageInfo, query, filterActions, sortActions, config); return XyzPage.wrap(pageInfo.createPage(items.map(convert))) If there are filters on properties in children entities: var query = Queries.createQuery(entityType.TYPE.get()) var pageInfo = new PageInfo(requestContext) Mapinvalid input: '<'String, List> filterActions = parseFilters(filters, config.propParse); List sortActions = parseSortActions(sorts, config.sortPropNames); var workToDo = Query.createRestrictionsOnRow(query, filterActions, config.queryProps) if (workToDo.contains(Child1) || workTodo.contains(GrandChild)) { var child1Table = query.join(Root.CHILD1ID_PROP.get()) QueryUtil.createRestrictionsOnRow(child1Table, actions, config.queryProps) if (workToDo.contains(GrandChild)) { var grandChildTable = child1Table.join(Child.GRANDCHILDID_PROP.get()) QueryUtil.createRestrictionsOnRow(grandChildTable, actions, config.queryProps) } } var select = query.select() var items = QueryUtil.setupResult(select, sortActions, pageInfo, config.queryProps) return XyzPage.wrap(pageInfo.createPage(items.map(convert)))

  • Method Details

    • performQuery

      public static <T extends KeyableBean> Stream<T> performQuery(@NotNull @NotNull PageInfo pageInfo, Query<T> query, List<String> filters, List<String> sorts, QueryPropertiesConfig<T> config)
      This is for simple cases where all filter properties are on main object, named filters should have already been applied to the query.
      Type Parameters:
      T - The database row KeyableBean object type
      Parameters:
      pageInfo - the page information (with max lines and max fetch)
      query - the database query
      filters - the filter actions
      sorts - this is the list of sort actions
      config - this is the configuration for this database entity
      Returns:
      a stream of those beans so they can be reformatted

    • performQuery

      public static <T extends KeyableBean> Stream<T> performQuery(@NotNull @NotNull PageInfo pageInfo, Query<T> query, Map<String,List<QueryUtil.FilterAction>> filterActions, List<QueryUtil.SortAction> sortActions, QueryPropertiesConfig<T> config)
      This is for simple cases where all filter properties are on main object, named filters should have already been applied to the query.
      Type Parameters:
      T - The KeyableBean type being returned
      Parameters:
      pageInfo - the page information (with max lines and max fetch)
      query - the database query
      filterActions - the filter actions
      sortActions - this is the list of sort actions
      config - this is the configuration for this database entity
      Returns:
      the stream of beans

    • parseFilters

      public static Map<String,List<QueryUtil.FilterAction>> parseFilters(List<String> filters, Map<String,QueryUtil.FunctionThatThrows> propParse)
      This will parse the query strings into a map of filters. Note that this is returned so that the caller can decide if any of these actions should be db query parameters or left for the stream to evaluate. The caller is responsible for converting named filters into appropriate db or stream filters.
      Parameters:
      filters - the strings received with the request
      propParse - the propParse that are support and how to parse the value into the object
      Returns:
      the map of filters, either by name or propertyName and list of filters

    • parseFilters

      public static Map<String,List<QueryUtil.FilterAction>> parseFilters(List<String> filters, Map<String,QueryUtil.FunctionThatThrows> propParse, Set<String> namedFilters)
      This will parse the filter strings into a map of filters for each property.
      Parameters:
      filters - the strings received with the request
      propParse - the propParse that are support and how to parse the value into the object
      namedFilters - the list the specialty filters names
      Returns:
      the map of filters, either by name or propertyname and list of filters

    • parseSortActions

      public static List<QueryUtil.SortAction> parseSortActions(List<String> sorts, Set<String> sortablePropNames)
      This will parse the sort parameters into sort actions
      Parameters:
      sorts - the sort actions string
      sortablePropNames - the accepted sort field names
      Returns:
      the sort actions

    • createRestrictionsOnRow

      public static Set<IEntityType> createRestrictionsOnRow(ISelectQueryBuilder query, Map<String,List<QueryUtil.FilterAction>> actions, Map<String,Pair<IEntityType,IEntityPropertyInfo>> queryFilterProperties)
      This will scan the list of actions for properties for this join table or the original query. If a query can be created for that property, it will remove the action from the action so that it does not have to be performed on the stream. This uses IEntityProperty ownership to determine if the this property belongs to a subtype or not. It will return the set of entity types that also have properties to be filtered.

      So the caller is responsible for the join the call structure looks something like: Set workToDo = Query.createRestrictionsOnRow(root, actions, properties) if (workToDo.contains(Child1) || workToDo.contains(GrandChild)) { Table child1Table = root.join(Root.CHILD1ID_PROP.get()); QueryUtil.createRestrictionsOnRow(child1Table, actions, properties); if (workToDo.contains(GrandChild)) { Table grandChildTable = child1Table.join(Child.GRANDCHILDID_PROP.get()); QueryUtil.createRestrictionsOnRow(grandChildTable, actions, properties); } }

      Parameters:
      query - the query or join table
      actions - the actions to perform on this table
      queryFilterProperties - the map of string to column info
      Returns:
      set of unhandled entity types

    • createDBCompare

      public static void createDBCompare(@NotNull @NotNull ISelectQueryBuilder query, IEntityPropertyInfo column, String op, Object value)
      This may create a restrictions for a filter action
      Parameters:
      query - the query to modify
      column - the column to process
      op - the operation to perform
      value - the value of the predicate

    • setupResult

      public static <T extends KeyableBean> Stream<T> setupResult(IQueryBeanResult<T> select, List<QueryUtil.SortAction> sortActions, @NotNull @NotNull PageInfo pageInfo, @NotNull @NotNull Map<String,Pair<IEntityType,IEntityPropertyInfo>> propSortProperty)
      This will create the stream from the query, i.e., add the sort and skip/limit functions to the stream. Note that if page size is zero, no rows will be returned.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of the stream
      Parameters:
      select - the select from the query
      propSortProperty - the supplier of the property for performing the sort
      Returns:
      the stream

    • filterStream

      public static <T> Stream<T> filterStream(@NotNull @NotNull Stream<T> stream, Map<String,List<QueryUtil.FilterAction>> actions, List<QueryUtil.SortAction> sortActions, PageInfo pageInfo, @NotNull @NotNull Map<String,Function<T,? extends Comparable>> propSortFetch, Map<String,Function<T,Stream<? extends Comparable>>> propFilterFetch)
      This will finish the stream, i.e., add the sort and skip/limit functions to the stream.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of the stream
      Parameters:
      stream - the stream to modify
      actions - the parsed filters, if defined (for the #skip, #limit)
      pageInfo - the pageInfo object
      propSortFetch - the supplier of the property for performing the sort
      propFilterFetch - the supplier of the property for performing filter (this is a stream, so that children's values can be used in the filter)
      Returns:
      the stream

    • collect

      public static <R, T> List<R> collect(Stream<T> stream, Function<T,R> convert)
      A helper function since I cannot seem to get gosu to perform this operation correctly.
      Type Parameters:
      R - the result type
      T - the source type
      Parameters:
      stream - the stream of T
      convert - a method to convert T to R
      Returns:
      a list of R

    • addStartAndLimit

      public static <T> Stream<T> addStartAndLimit(@NotNull @NotNull Stream<T> stream, PageInfo pageInfo)
      This will add the skip and limit actions
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type the stream is iterating over
      Parameters:
      stream - the stream to adjust
      Returns:
      the stream with the skip and limit actions
